title: All you need to know about upcoming National T20 Cup
text:
One of the biggest opportunities for the national players, National T20 Cup, is just around the corner and performers can get a chance to represent Pakistan against Australia in a three-match T20I series in November this year.

A 12-day tournament kicks off October 13 in Faisalabad and will conclude on the 24th of the same month. Six regions including Southern Punjab, Central Punjab, Northern, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Sindh, Baluchistan.

Here are some important things you need to know about the National T20 Cup

Playing format

The tournament will be played on a round-robin format where all six regions will play each other once which means one team will play five matches each. Top-two teams at the end of the round stage will play the final contest on October 14 at an eye-catching venue, Iqbal Stadium.

Tickets sale

The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) aims to bring more crowd during the tournament as they kept the tickets price very cheap. Enclosures other than Javed Miandad cost PKR 100 while tickets for Javed Miandad enclosure, which has been reserved for just families, will charge 200 Rs.

Tickets will be available on streets leading to the stadium which include Riaz Shahid Chowk, Stadium Road, Umar Masjid DPS School, Jail Road, Main Gate, Commissioner Officer, near Larri Adda.

According to the PCB Director Commercial, Babar Hamid, the board has reserved a separate enclosure for families so that parents can feel comfortable while enjoying the action-packed tournament which features over 96 national and international stars of Pakistan.

Prize money

After an increase of 100 percent, the winning prize money of the tournament has been increased from PKR 2.5 million to 5 million. The runners-up will get the prize purse of PKR 2.5 million.

Man-of-the-match in each contest will purse PKR 25,000 while man-of-the-final will get PKR 35,000. Tournament’s best bowler, batsman, wicket-keeper will receive PKR 100,000 each.

Each player from playing XI will pocket PKR 40,000/match while players on bench will get PKR 16,000.
